content.description: Identify the rhythms. After a question is announced, you will have ten seconds to read the choices. It is important that you read the choices carefully before the example is played. Each example will be played twice, with a brief pause between playings.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. It has two measures with the time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score A is: sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches are: C3, D3, E3, F3, G3, A3, and G3. The rhythm in measure 2 of score A is: dotted quarter and dotted quarter rest. The pitch is F3.

Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. It has two measures with the time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 2 of score B is: sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, quarter, and eighth. The pitches are C3, D3, E3, F3, G3, A3, and G3. The final measure of score B has a dotted quarter F3 and dotted quarter rest.

Score C has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. It has two measures with the time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score C is: sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, quarter tied to sixteenth, and sixteenth. The pitches are: C3, D3, E3, F3, G3, A3 tied, and G3. Measure 2 of score C has a dotted quarter F3 and dotted quarter rest.

Score D has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. It has two measures with the time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score D is: sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and dotted quarter. The pitches are: C3, D3, E3, F3, G3, A3, and G3. The final measure has a dotted quarter F3 and a dotted quarter rest.

content.answer: Score A has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. It has two measures with the time signature of six eight time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score A is: sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, sixteenth, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches are: C3, D3, E3, F3, G3, A3, and G3. The rhythm in measure 2 of score A is: dotted quarter and dotted quarter rest. The pitch is F3.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
